page.title: 08The paper-boy
page.content: The paper-boy delivers newspapers to people in their houses or places of work. Newspapers are magazines containing news. These usually come out daily or sometimes weekly. The paper-boy carries these in a bag. He puts the papers through the letter-box which is a slit in a door. The owner of the house collects the paper by pulling the paper through the slit. When the paper-boy gets back to the newsagents he leaves his bag. He is usually paid at the end of the week. The newspapers are printed in a factory and sent out to the newsagent's shops daily. The shopowners then give the papers to the paper-boy who delivers them on foot or by bicycle.
